## ControllerProps type

Render function to provide the control for the field.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export type ControllerProps<TFieldValues extends FieldValues = FieldValues, TName extends FieldPath<TFieldValues> = FieldPath<TFieldValues>> = {
    render: ({ field, fieldState, formState, }: {
        field: ControllerRenderProps<TFieldValues, TName>;
        fieldState: ControllerFieldState;
        formState: UseFormStateReturn<TFieldValues>;
    }) => React.ReactElement;
} & UseControllerProps<TFieldValues, TName>;
```
**References:** [FieldValues](./react-hook-form.fieldvalues.md)<!-- -->, [FieldPath](./react-hook-form.fieldpath.md)<!-- -->, [ControllerRenderProps](./react-hook-form.controllerrenderprops.md)<!-- -->, [ControllerFieldState](./react-hook-form.controllerfieldstate.md)<!-- -->, [UseFormStateReturn](./react-hook-form.useformstatereturn.md)<!-- -->, [UseControllerProps](./react-hook-form.usecontrollerprops.md)

## Example


```tsx
const { field, fieldState, formState } = useController();

<Controller
  render={({ field, formState, fieldState }) => ({
    <input
      onChange={field.onChange}
      onBlur={field.onBlur}
      name={field.name}
      ref={field.ref} // optional for focus management
    />
  })}
/>
```
